truth: -  "Coral reefs are some of the most diverse ecosystems in the world, housing tens of thousands of marine species."
fiction: -  "Coral reefs are some of the most barren ecosystems in the world, housing only a handful of marine species."

truth: -  "The Great Barrier Reef is the largest coral reef system in the world, stretching over 2,300 kilometers."
fiction: -  "The Great Barrier Reef is the smallest coral reef system in the world, stretching only 2.3 kilometers."

truth: -  "Marine algae and phytoplankton are primary producers in the ocean, converting sunlight into energy through photosynthesis."
fiction: -  "Marine algae and phytoplankton are primary consumers in the ocean, hunting small fish for energy."

truth: -  "The blue whale is the largest animal ever known to have existed, reaching lengths of up to 100 feet."
fiction: -  "The blue whale is the smallest animal ever known to have existed, reaching lengths of only 1 inch."

truth: -  "Sharks have a skeleton made of cartilage, which is lighter and more flexible than bone."
fiction: -  "Sharks have a skeleton made of solid gold, which is heavier and more valuable than bone."

truth: -  "The Mariana Trench in the western Pacific is the deepest part of the world's oceans, reaching depths of over 36,000 feet."
fiction: -  "The Mariana Trench in the western Pacific is the shallowest part of the world's oceans, reaching depths of only 3 feet."

truth: -  "Sea turtles return to the same nesting grounds at which they were born to lay their own eggs."
fiction: -  "Sea turtles return to the highest mountain peaks to lay their own eggs."

truth: -  "The giant squid has the largest eyes in the animal kingdom, measuring up to 10 inches in diameter."
fiction: -  "The giant squid has the smallest eyes in the animal kingdom, measuring only 0.1 inches in diameter."

truth: -  "The ocean covers more than 70% of the Earth's surface."
fiction: -  "The ocean covers less than 1% of the Earth's surface."

truth: -  "Marine biologists study life in the oceans, from microscopic plankton to the largest whales."
fiction: -  "Marine biologists study life in the desert, from microscopic sand grains to the largest cacti."

truth: -  "The Great White Shark is known to have the strongest bite force of any shark, estimated to be over 4,000 pounds per square inch."
fiction: -  "The Great White Shark is known to have the weakest bite force of any shark, estimated to be less than 1 pound per square inch."

truth: -  "Jellyfish have been in existence for over 500 million years, making them one of the oldest living creatures on Earth."
fiction: -  "Jellyfish have been in existence for only 5 years, making them one of the newest creatures on Earth."

truth: -  "The ocean is home to nearly 95% of all life on Earth."
fiction: -  "The ocean is home to nearly no life, with 95% of all life on Earth found in the sky."

truth: -  "The starfish, or sea star, is not actually a fish, but an echinoderm, closely related to sea urchins and sand dollars."
fiction: -  "The starfish, or sea star, is not actually a marine creature, but a celestial body, closely related to comets and asteroids."

truth: -  "The Portuguese man o' war is not a single organism, but a colony of specialized individual animals called zooids."
fiction: -  "The Portuguese man o' war is not a marine creature, but a historical naval vessel from Portugal."

truth: -  "Seahorses are the only animals in which the male carries and gives birth to the young."
fiction: -  "Seahorses are the only animals in which the young carry and give birth to the male."

truth: -  "The ocean's tides are primarily caused by the gravitational pull of the moon and the sun."
fiction: -  "The ocean's tides are primarily caused by the world's whales swimming in synchrony."

truth: -  "Mangroves are trees that can live in salt water and are important for protecting coastlines from erosion."
fiction: -  "Mangroves are trees that can live in outer space and are important for protecting planets from meteor impacts."

truth: -  "Marine bioluminescence is the production and emission of light by a living organism in the sea."
fiction: -  "Marine bioluminescence is the production and emission of ice cream by a living organism in the sea."
